I will construct a highly polished, mobile-first 'Magic Tiles' rhythm game with a clean, light-mode aesthetic, strictly using vanilla HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, with Tailwind CSS for styling. The user's specific requests will be fully implemented. The UI will be significantly improved with better fonts, spacing, and a redesigned score display for a more professional feel. The core new feature is a song selection screen. Since directly analyzing YouTube audio for beat-mapping is not feasible with client-side JavaScript, I will simulate this by creating a system with pre-configured songs. Each song option will link to a specific YouTube video ID and a custom-made 'beatmap' (a predefined array that dictates the tile sequence). When a user selects a song, the game will use the YouTube Iframe Player API to embed and play the selected video for audio, while simultaneously spawning tiles based on the corresponding beatmap, creating a synchronized and engaging gameplay experience. The game will also feature sound effects for taps, a progressive difficulty curve where the speed increases with the score, and distinct lanes with a tap-zone line at the bottom. The project will be organized into three separate files: `index.html` for the structure including the new song selection and game-over screens, `css/main.css` for custom tile animations and lane styling, and `js/main.js` to house the comprehensive game logic, including state management, YouTube API integration, beatmap handling, and audio feedback.
